body:
> I use 8.3.0-es7，and have the same issue after I restarted the k8s master node.

I fixed it by re-run the `skywalking-es-init` job (, by `re-run`, I actually mean `helm delete` the skywalking release, and installed it again)

> javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: 

@kezhenxu94 This seems definitely showing up in the agent testing. But always be good in other tests. I think something breaking.
@kezhenxu94 Should we keep merging this? I think we have no clue about the mvnw issue.

> @kezhenxu94 Should we keep merging this? I think we have no clue about the mvnw issue.

Let's merge this
let's try to chance jdk versions e2e testing? Remove some version or rename? It is strange they always fail on that mission only.

> Add a doc about how to run through docker and docker compose?
> docker repo should be archived later.

Added
@xuanyuanaosheng the same problem,  oap:8.5.0
@Superskyyy FYI 😉
Closed by https://github.com/apache/skywalking-cli/pull/104

Do you want to contribute this? This is not a critical issue. We don't check this in all database implementations, such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, TiDB.
Of course, it is fine to add if you want.

@lzdujing Can you provide a zip to replace the rar package? In addition, the error log of the agent is also needed, which is a bit busy these days. I will take time to follow up on this issue during the weekend.

Hi @wu-sheng, can I contribute here? This would be my first contribution. I think I got what is required; additional check in all DBClients (like this: https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/f61dff9a9f1d1f8ddd11c31f039e540521479d36/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-influxdb-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/influxdb/InfluxClient.java) to check if the the DB property (in this case: InfluxDB influx) is already initialized or not.(if it is then log some info and return?)
Basically you can, just should notice, whether database creation could require more parameters, and only create if it missed.
due to start the container cost a long time, if `@ClassRule` is unstable or can't save enough time, I think we have to ignore apollo's IT cases. @wu-sheng @kezhenxu94
How much time are you talking about for CI? Could you compare between the previous time and current?
@zifeihan I'll provide a zip today.

> How much time are you talking about for CI? Could you compare between the previous time and current?

start the container needs more than 1 minute, if don't share the container, the 2 cases could cost more than 3 minutes
I am OK to remove it from CI process, but we should keep it runnable locally after minimal change when we need it.
CI Passed, it's cost 2-3min, use `@ClassRule`
@kezhenxu94 What do you think? It is already 25 mins for CI with IT.

> @kezhenxu94 What do you think? It is already 25 mins for CI with IT.

It's ok for me if it's stable enough. I can find other means to reduce CI waiting time, but flaky tests are intolerable to me. It's ok to me now. Let's see how it will behave.
@zifeihan I have uploaded the  non-compressed demo already.
Please resolve conflicts first.
I just checked, it is up and running from my browser side.

> ### How to reproduce
> Go to https://skywalking.apache.org/#demo
> And then https://demo.skywalking.apache.org/

@williamdes in the demo env, we don't support https, please force to use http if you browser automatically directs from http to https

Please fix your website or server
The go button sends you to https..
I can help setup https if you have an infrastructure repository
I use Brave browser, maybe this is what causes the issue

The source codes of website are here.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website

Thank you !
Indeed the link is http, where is the infrastructure managed ?

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/e481896aff488819be6043663dd3e919b25c18be/content/_index.html#L81

No other infra manages that, Apache Software Foundation uses Apache server hosts static page. 
Like @kezhenxu94 said, this is more like browser side setting. 
You could check http page on your browser, then you know whether link is changed or not.
Please go ahead.
FYI @wankai123

> You could check http page on your browser, then you know whether link is changed or not.

My browser and a lot of other ones do HTTPS upgrades without asking

> No other infra manages that, Apache Software Foundation uses Apache server hosts static page.

My question was what infrastructure hosts the demo server ?
It is a private GCP VM, sponsored by Tetrate.
The link to python doc should be updated to website later.

I've been thinking about migrating maven to gradle for some time and now we might start to consider.

Gradle claims to be faster than maven, and according to my test, it costs ~5 min (locally) ~15 min (in GitHub action) with integration tests and parallel enabled, compared to maven's ~30 min (without parallel). Gradle is also better at parallel build, incremental compilation. I don't want to list all cons and pros between Gradle and maven, but for now, Gradle can help to mitigate our pain point a lot

If glradle is on the plan, let's wait for a little longer.
I just don't want us to change too many thinga. Splitting the repo and replace ElasticSearch client are already big moves for 8.8.0

> It is a private GCP VM, sponsored by Tetrate.

Okay, I would recommend you to use acme.sh
It's easy and open source, a git clone and run bash solution

> > It is a private GCP VM, sponsored by Tetrate.
> 
> Okay, I would recommend you to use acme.sh
> It's easy and open source, a git clone and run bash solution

It is just a VM on the Google cloud, nothing special. All in the runtime are SkyWalking binary.
So Google Cloud does not provide an SSL overlay ??

> So Google Cloud does not provide an SSL overlay ??

The key issues is, SSL private keys are managed by Apache Software Foundation Infra team, which requires everything has to been deployed on the ASF Infra. But this demo is deployed on the 3rd party, sponsor VM. So, we can't have the key, but the domain name is under skywalking.apache.org, then, we have to keep it in http only.

@wu-sheng @dmsolr @lzdujing Sorry for being late. I have been too busy recently. Through debugging, I found that the thrift plugin processes TBaseProcessor and TBaseAsyncProcessor, but the demo reference uses TMultiplexedProcessor, so an exception has occurred. I am repairing and testing. I will submit pr tomorrow.

Thanks, @zifeihan 
Yes, I really didn't cover this case `TMultiplexedProcessor`.

@lzdujing It has been tested on your demo project, and the test results are all normal. I have been busy recently, so the related test scenario has not been added. If you have time, can you submit a pr to help cover the related test scenario?
Do I wait the Java PR to be ready first? In case something can be reused. Looks like a very big feature there base on the LOC.
@hanahmily Please confirm tye statue of that PR.
Thank you very much. I'll check it tody.

ok. i try modify more in time. thanks for review and advise

[EventQueryDAO](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/94623f283139e31484979205ef7c14d73c91b0d0/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-influxdb-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/influxdb/query/EventQueryDAO.java#L73) and [ESEventQueryDAO](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/94623f283139e31484979205ef7c14d73c91b0d0/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-elasticsearch-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/elasticsearch/query/ESEventQueryDAO.java#L128) use the pagination ("limit" and "from") of the first condition. However, [H2EventQueryDAO](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/94623f283139e31484979205ef7c14d73c91b0d0/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-jdbc-hikaricp-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/jdbc/h2/dao/H2EventQueryDAO.java#L115) adopts the [sum of limit size of all condition](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/94623f283139e31484979205ef7c14d73c91b0d0/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-jdbc-hikaricp-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/jdbc/h2/dao/H2EventQueryDAO.java#L100) with out offset. Should I modify H2EventQueryDAO according to the other two? @wu-sheng
I am not sure what does first condition mean. @kezhenxu94 should know more than me.
Please update `changes.md` in the root for changelog.
@Superskyyy FYI https://github.com/apache/skywalking-swck/pull/30 is merged
the screenshots

Hi @LIU-WEI-git , thank you for reporting this, the `H2EventQueryDAO` should use the same logic with `EventQueryDAO` and `ESEventQueryDAO`. The first condition serves as a prototype of the query condition list so we should not use the sum of limit size of all conditions as the result limit, which would be unreasonably large and not expected use case.
Got it. I will submit a PR soon.

> @Superskyyy FYI [apache/skywalking-swck#30](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-swck/pull/30) is merged

Okay, my turn then.
@chenyi19851209 We still need you to polish a little more.

> Please update `changes.md` in the root for changelog.

ok. i add changelog  in changes.md
A global pop up tooltip should be enough , we don’t need to think about where to put the error message per page.

> A global pop up tooltip should be enough , we don’t need to think about where to put the error message per page.

Agree. Just notice, as we request multiple GraphQL query(s) continuously, we may need be able to show multiple pop up tooltips.
i alse met this problem, have you solve it ?
Resolved by https://github.com/apache/skywalking-swck/pull/30
This was to track the first set of commands and now that the basic commands are added, we can open new issues per command if specific commands are needed.

We don't support fuzzy search on the 2 storages because they are not good at indexing and searching, or is poor performant, or is not recommended in production environment, I don't know how you will implement this?
This is not a bug, it is designed likr this. Check the APIs, they response to UI whether this storage supports content fuzzy query.
Got it. Thanks for your explanation.
This is not in the scope of SkyWalking.

> One UT fails, please fix

ok.done

Weird finding, the Sanic plugin seems to fail on Python 3.6(passes on 3.7-3.9) when I switch to CLI based test.
 
Sanic dropped support for Python 3.6 https://github.com/sanic-org/sanic except for a LTS version(20.12.x) which our test still fails on, need further investigation.

Also found out we may need a review of tested lib versions as many have evolved over a major version number since the plugins are added. Testing for unsupported versions(like Django==2.0) is slowing down the CI.

> Also found out we may need a review of tested lib versions as many have evolved over a major version number since the plugins are added. Testing for unsupported versions(like Django==2.0) is slowing down the CI.

That is reasonable and we can review the tested version from time to time, or have automatic pipeline to check the newer versions of the libs. 

We typically only test the latest 3 major versions of the libs (if we claim to support it), if that still slows down the CI, we can consider parallelize the tests (pytest supports parallel tests but we need some adjustments)

> Weird finding, the Sanic plugin seems to fail on Python 3.6(passes on 3.7-3.9) when I switch to CLI based test.

Any logs?

> > Weird finding, the Sanic plugin seems to fail on Python 3.6(passes on 3.7-3.9) when I switch to CLI based test.
> 
> Any logs?

CLI based run - fails on Python 3.6 b/c provider.py reporting a exit span from 7002(requests) instead of entry span from 7007(sanic)
https://github.com/Superskyyy/skywalking-python/runs/3625969357
Original run - passes for all versions
https://github.com/Superskyyy/skywalking-python/actions/runs/1243676935
Since we redesign the index structures which impacts other parts. I  will set up another issue to track this topic
When the index is time series and there is multiple indices on the same alias, the query would fail, here is the local verification
@Superskyyy please just ignore that error if you cannot figure out why shortly, and continue the process, when you open the PR, I can help to debug locally

> @Superskyyy please just ignore that error if you cannot figure out why shortly, and continue the process, when you open the PR, I can help to debug locally

Thanks, the others are done and passed, opening pr soon.

When is the latest date of this project? I haven't heard it for a while.

I also encountered this problem in the latest version

**version:** 8.7.0
**docker-compose.yml**
```version: '3'
services:
  oap:
    image: apache/skywalking-oap-server:8.7.0-es7
    container_name: oap
    restart: always
    ports:
      - 11800:11800
      - 12800:12800
    environment:
      - SW_STORAGE=elasticsearch7
      - SW_STORAGE_ES_CLUSTER_NODES=172.17.20.45:9200
      - SW_NAMESPACE=skywalking
      - SW_CORE_RECORD_DATA_TTL=3
      - SW_CORE_METRICS_DATA_TTL=3
      - TZ=Asia/Shanghai
  skywaling-ui:
    image: apache/skywalking-ui:8.7.0
    container_name: ui
    depends_on:
      - oap
    links:
      - oap
    ports:
      - 8888:8080
    environment:
      - SW_OAP_ADDRESS=http://oap:12800
      - TZ=Asia/Shanghai
   ```

Is there a solution?

> When is the latest date of this project? I haven't heard it for a while.

druid the latest version 1.2.6 release on Apr, 2021.
OK, then it is fine to have plugin for it.
For anyone refers to this in the future, a node ip becoming a pod ip happens in situations where a daemonset has ports exposed on hostnetwork.
